metadata.title: Scale Emotional Map
metadata.author: Sean Burdge / Claude
metadata.description: Comprehensive reference mapping musical scales to emotional qualities, genre associations, chord types, and related scales
metadata.usage_note: Intervals are relative to root - apply to any of 12 root notes to get actual pitches

related_scales.name: Lydian
related_scales.relationship: Raised 4th creates brighter, more ethereal quality

related_scales.name: Major Pentatonic
related_scales.relationship: Removes 4th and 7th for simpler, folk-like sound

related_scales.name: Aeolian (Natural Minor)
related_scales.relationship: Dorian has raised 6th, creating less dark quality

related_scales.name: Mixolydian
related_scales.relationship: Parallel major mode with same b7

related_scales.name: Phrygian Dominant
related_scales.relationship: Raised 3rd creates major/minor tension, more flamenco

related_scales.name: Lydian Dominant
related_scales.relationship: Lydian with b7, jazzy fusion sound

related_scales.name: Dorian
related_scales.relationship: Parallel minor mode with same b7

related_scales.name: Minor Pentatonic
related_scales.relationship: Removes 2nd and b6 for simpler, bluesy sound

common_progressions: i° - bII (rarely used as tonal center)
Used more as color over m7b5 chords than as key center

related_scales.name: Phrygian
related_scales.relationship: Locrian with natural 5th, usable as tonal center

related_scales.name: Locrian #2
related_scales.relationship: Locrian with natural 2nd, slightly less harsh

related_scales.name: Super Locrian
related_scales.relationship: Even more altered, used over altered dominant chords

related_scales.name: Aeolian (Natural Minor)
related_scales.relationship: Harmonic minor with b7, weaker dominant

related_scales.name: Phrygian Dominant
related_scales.relationship: 5th mode of harmonic minor, flamenco sound

common_progressions: Used primarily as color over half-diminished chords

related_scales.name: Locrian
related_scales.relationship: Locrian #6 has raised 6th, slightly less dark

common_progressions: Used as passing color in jazz voicings

related_scales.name: Lydian Augmented
related_scales.relationship: Similar #5 but with #4 instead of natural 4

related_scales.name: Lydian b7
related_scales.relationship: Major version with similar #4 and b7

common_progressions: i (minor) - bII - I (major) - Andalusian cadence variation

related_scales.name: Phrygian
related_scales.relationship: b3 instead of natural 3, fully minor

related_scales.name: Harmonic Minor
related_scales.relationship: Phrygian Dominant is 5th mode of Harmonic Minor

related_scales.name: Double Harmonic Major
related_scales.relationship: Similar exotic flavor with different intervals

common_progressions: Primarily used as color/texture rather than functional harmony

related_scales.name: Harmonic Minor
related_scales.relationship: Lydian #2 is 6th mode of Harmonic Minor

degrees.i°: Rarely used functionally - primarily melodic color

common_progressions: Used as extreme tension over diminished or altered chords

related_scales.name: Locrian
related_scales.relationship: More stable version with natural 4th and 7th

common_progressions: Often used for improvisation over min/maj7 chords

related_scales.name: Dorian
related_scales.relationship: Melodic minor with b7, less sophisticated

related_scales.name: Harmonic Minor
related_scales.relationship: Melodic minor with b6, more classical tension

related_scales.name: Ionian (Major)
related_scales.relationship: Only differs by b3, minor vs major

common_progressions: Used primarily as color over maj7#5 chords

related_scales.name: Whole Tone
related_scales.relationship: Similar floating quality, even fewer anchor points

common_progressions: Used over dominant 7th chords, especially tritone subs
Used over dominant chords resolving to minor

related_scales.name: Aeolian
related_scales.relationship: b3 instead of natural 3, fully minor

common_progressions: Primary use: improvising over m7b5 chords in ii-V-i

basic: Used over altered dominant chords - not for building progressions
common_progressions: Used for maximum tension before resolution

related_scales.name: Phrygian
related_scales.relationship: Natural 4th and 5th, usable as tonal center

common_progressions: Works over any major key progression

related_scales.name: Ionian (Major)
related_scales.relationship: Adds 4th and 7th for full major scale

related_scales.name: Aeolian
related_scales.relationship: Adds 2nd and b6 for full natural minor

degrees: No clear major/minor - suspended quality throughout

related_scales.name: Dorian
related_scales.relationship: Adds b3 and 6 for full Dorian

related_scales.name: Phrygian
related_scales.relationship: Adds b3 and b6 for full Phrygian

related_scales.name: Aeolian
related_scales.relationship: Adds 4th and b7 for full natural minor

degrees.Works over: i7, IV7, V7 in blues context
degrees.The b5 (blue note): Creates tension that resolves to 4 or 5

common_progressions: 12-bar blues: I7 - IV7 - I7 - V7 - IV7 - I7

related_scales.name: Minor Blues
related_scales.relationship: Often combined for full blues vocabulary

common_progressions: No traditional progressions - all chords are equivalent
Used for dominant tension before resolution

related_scales.name: Whole-Half Diminished
related_scales.relationship: Inverted pattern, used over dim7 chords

related_scales.name: Harmonic Minor
related_scales.relationship: V chord derives from harmonic minor

related_scales.name: Whole Tone
related_scales.relationship: Different symmetric approach to augmented sounds

related_scales.name: Ionian #5
related_scales.relationship: More conventional scale with augmented tonic

degrees.The added #5: Creates chromatic passing tone between 5 and 6

related_scales.name: Phrygian Dominant
related_scales.relationship: b2 and b6, but b7 instead of natural 7

related_scales.name: Double Harmonic Major
related_scales.relationship: Similar exotic quality, major instead of minor

related_scales.name: Phrygian
related_scales.relationship: Adds 4th and b7 for full Phrygian

related_scales.name: Dorian
related_scales.relationship: Adds 4th and b7 for full Dorian

related_scales.name: Locrian
related_scales.relationship: Adds b3 and b6 for full Locrian

common_progressions: Andalusian cadence: Am - G - F - E
The iv chord creates melancholy in major context

degrees.The natural 7: Adds leading tone to whole tone base
